mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.20:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
an10.20:2.3.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.

an10.20:6.1.en: And how does a mendicant have four supports?

an10.20:6.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu caturāpasseno hoti.
an10.20:6.3.en: That’s how a mendicant has four supports.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10.20
2. A Protector
Abodes of the Noble Ones (2nd)

dn33:3.3.51.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
dn33:3.3.51.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.

dn33:3.3.63.en: And how does a mendicant have four supports?

dn33:3.3.65.pli: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu caturāpasseno hoti.
dn33:3.3.65.en: That’s how a mendicant has four supports.

dn34:2.3.66.pli: idhāvuso, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
dn34:2.3.66.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.

dn34:2.3.81.en: And how does a mendicant have four supports?

dn34:2.3.83.pli: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu caturāpasseno hoti.
dn34:2.3.83.en: That’s how a mendicant has four supports.

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.19:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti, chaḷaṅgasamannāgato, ekārakkho, caturāpasseno, paṇunnapaccekasacco, samavayasaṭṭhesano, anāvilasaṅkappo, passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro, suvimuttacitto, suvimuttapañño.
an10.19:1.3.en: A mendicant has given up five factors, is endowed with six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has pure intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.

Numbered Discourses 10.19
2. A Protector
Abodes of the Noble Ones (1st)
